alert.note: Alert for Flathead; Lake; Missoula; Ravalli (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued July 31 at 1:53PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT... The Montana Department of Environmental Quality has issued an air quality alert for Flathead, Lake, Missoula, and Ravalli counties in effect until 2PM August 1st. Elevated particulate levels from wildfire smoke. This alert will be updated again at 2PM August 1st. An Air Quality Alert means that particulates have been trending upwards and that an exceedence of the 24 hour National Ambient Air Quality Standard (NAAQS) has occurred or may occur in the near future. As of 2PM, Particulate levels in Seeley Lake are Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups. As of 2PM, Particulate levels in Frenchtown, Hamilton, Missoula are Moderate. When air quality is Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups... State and local health officials recommend that people with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should limit prolonged exertion. When air quality is Moderate... State and local health officials recommend that unusually sensitive people should consider reducing prolonged or heavy exertion. For more information visit the Montana Department of Environmental Quality at http://todaysair.mtdeq.us
